case.name: Calliden Group Limited in the matter of Calliden Group Limited [2007] FCA 2019 (19 December 2007)

citation.tocase: Australian Health Insurance Association Ltd v Esso Australia Ltd (1993) 41 FCR 450
citation.text: 69 I accept the submission made by counsel for the applicants that the deed poll did not provide for insurance but was in the nature of a guarantee. Counsel referred to the distinction between contracts of insurance and other classes of contract including contracts of guarantee recognised in such cases as Prudential Insurance Company v Inland Revenue Commissioners [1904] 2 KB 658 at 662-664 per Channell J; Australian Health Insurance Association Ltd v Esso Australia Ltd (1993) 41 FCR 450; Seaton v Heath [1899] 1 QB 782 at 789, 792; Re Australian & Overseas Insurance Co Ltd [1966] 1 NSWR 558 per McLelland CJ in Eq.

citation.tocase: Prudential Insurance Company v Inland Revenue Commissioners [1904] 2 KB 658
citation.text: 69 I accept the submission made by counsel for the applicants that the deed poll did not provide for insurance but was in the nature of a guarantee. Counsel referred to the distinction between contracts of insurance and other classes of contract including contracts of guarantee recognised in such cases as Prudential Insurance Company v Inland Revenue Commissioners [1904] 2 KB 658 at 662-664 per Channell J; Australian Health Insurance Association Ltd v Esso Australia Ltd (1993) 41 FCR 450; Seaton v Heath [1899] 1 QB 782 at 789, 792; Re Australian & Overseas Insurance Co Ltd [1966] 1 NSWR 558 per McLelland CJ in Eq.

citation.tocase: Re Armstrong Jones Life Assurance Ltd (1997) 74 FCR 160
citation.text: 81 In Re Armstrong Jones Life Assurance Ltd (1997) 74 FCR 160, Emmett J had held that a provision in the Life Insurance Act 1995 (Cth) analogous to s 17C(2) of the Act did not lay down a condition precedent to the existence of jurisdiction in the Federal Court to confirm a scheme. In Re Royal & Sun Alliance Life Assurance Ltd [2000] FCA 1259 ; (2000) 104 FCR 37, Katz J adopted the same approach because his Honour did not think that Emmett J had been plainly wrong. In Re Insurance Australia Ltd [2004] FCA 524 ; (2004) 139 FCR 450, although with some doubt, I adopted the same approach, namely, of following Emmett J because I did not think his Honour was plainly wrong (at [63]). A similar approach was subsequently taken by Bennett J in Re MLC Lifetime Company Ltd (No 2) [2006] FCA 1367 at [11] . Perhaps predictably, I took the same approach in the present case in relation to the question of jurisdiction.

citation.tocase: Re Australian & Overseas Insurance Co Ltd [1966] 1 NSWR 558
citation.text: 69 I accept the submission made by counsel for the applicants that the deed poll did not provide for insurance but was in the nature of a guarantee. Counsel referred to the distinction between contracts of insurance and other classes of contract including contracts of guarantee recognised in such cases as Prudential Insurance Company v Inland Revenue Commissioners [1904] 2 KB 658 at 662-664 per Channell J; Australian Health Insurance Association Ltd v Esso Australia Ltd (1993) 41 FCR 450; Seaton v Heath [1899] 1 QB 782 at 789, 792; Re Australian & Overseas Insurance Co Ltd [1966] 1 NSWR 558 per McLelland CJ in Eq.

citation.tocase: Re Insurance Australia Ltd [2004] FCA 524 ; (2004) 139 FCR 450

In Re Insurance Australia Ltd [2004] FCA 524 ; (2004) 139 FCR 450, although with some doubt, I adopted the same approach, namely, of following Emmett J because I did not think his Honour was plainly wrong (at [63]). A similar approach was subsequently taken by Bennett J in Re MLC Lifetime Company Ltd (No 2) [2006] FCA 1367 at [11] . Perhaps predictably, I took the same approach in the present case in relation to the question of jurisdiction.

citation.tocase: Re Royal & Sun Alliance Life Assurance Ltd [2000] FCA 1259 ; (2000) 104 FCR 37

69 I accept the submission made by counsel for the applicants that the deed poll did not provide for insurance but was in the nature of a guarantee. Counsel referred to the distinction between contracts of insurance and other classes of contract including contracts of guarantee recognised in such cases as Prudential Insurance Company v Inland Revenue Commissioners [1904] 2 KB 658 at 662-664 per Channell J; Australian Health Insurance Association Ltd v Esso Australia Ltd (1993) 41 FCR 450; Seaton v Heath [1899] 1 QB 782 at 789, 792; Re Australian & Overseas Insurance Co Ltd [1966] 1 NSWR 558 per McLelland CJ in Eq.
